meanings.definition: Not characteristic of or suitable for literature.
meanings.sent1: The simple and direct language used in the manual was very unliterary.
meanings.sent2: Her unliterary writing style focused more on facts than on poetic language.
meanings.sent3: The unliterary shopping list she wrote was so straightforward that it made her friend laugh.
meanings.sent4: His speech was so unliterary that it felt like he was reading a grocery list.
meanings.sent5: The unliterary description of the sunset painted a clear picture in the reader's mind.

meanings.sent1: The unliterary movie lacked depth and failed to engage the audience.
meanings.sent2: The book received criticism for its unliterary plot and shallow characters.
meanings.sent3: Despite its unliterary nature, the story had a quirky charm that some readers enjoyed.
meanings.sent4: The unliterary dialogue between the characters made the scene feel awkward and unrealistic.
meanings.sent5: Her unliterary poem was quickly forgotten among the more impactful works of the competition.
